author: m.kalinin
content:
I believe that at least upgrades introducing changes to execution payload structure should be coordinated as this structure exists in both layers. Otherwise, EL or CL (depending on which layer upgrades first) would have to implicitly convert old payload version to the new one which is potentially dangerous. How would Engine API upgrade look like in this case?

If there is an upgrade that doesn't require coordination between layers then fine, it can be entirely transparent for unaffected layer. Thus, EL should have a fork trigger allowing for coordination with CL when needed.

author: sky.cactus
content: In general, I think having a transitionary period is better/safer.  It *is* more engineering work to go through a transition, but I think the risk reduction is worth it rather than trying to upgrade everything at once.

author: m.kalinin
content: Except messing up with coordination itself (e.g. picking up a timestamp that doesn't correspond to an epoch) is there any other compounding risk that you have in mind?

author: sky.cactus
content: Nothing specific.  It is one of those things (trying to upgrade multiple systems at the same time) that just tends to lead to failure worse than any individual part failing would have.
